title: Critical Vulnerabilities in Ivanti EPMM Exploited
summary: Zero-day vulns in enterprise mobility management platforms are the new crown jewels for attackers—and these Ivanti flaws prove that mobile device management has become ground zero for corporate infiltration.
editorial_note: Critical infrastructure impact with active exploitation

title: Researchers Show Copilot and Grok Can Be Abused as Malware C2 Proxies
summary: AI assistants with web browsing capabilities can be weaponized as stealthy command-and-control relays. The irony is palpable: the tools meant to make us more productive are now potential accomplices in our digital downfall.

title: Introducing Claude Sonnet 4.6
summary: Anthropic drops another model iteration in the endless AI arms race.

title: GPT-5.2 derives a new result in theoretical physics
summary: When AI systems start contributing original mathematical proofs to physics, we've crossed a threshold that deserves serious attention. This isn't just pattern matching anymore—it's genuine scientific discovery, raising profound questions about the future of human intellectual contribution.
editorial_note: Landmark achievement in AI-driven scientific discovery

title: CDT Testimony on Maryland Senate Algorithmic Grocery Pricing Bill
summary: As algorithms increasingly set the prices we pay for basic necessities, Maryland's legislative hearing on algorithmic grocery pricing represents a critical battleground for consumer protection in the age of dynamic pricing systems.

title: San Jose Can Protect Immigrants by Ending Flock Surveillance System
summary: The intersection of automated license plate recognition and immigration enforcement creates a digital dragnet that turns every street corner into a potential checkpoint. San Jose's decision could set precedent for sanctuary cities nationwide.
